Package com.Group1

Class BinarySearchTreeWithRotate<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

java.lang.Object
com.Group1.BinaryTree<E>
com.Group1.BinarySearchTree<E>
com.Group1.BinarySearchTreeWithRotate<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SearchTree<E>, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AVLTree
public class BinarySearchTreeWithRotate<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
extends BinarySearchTree<E>
This class extends the BinarySearchTree by adding the rotate operations. Rotation will change the balance of a search tree while preserving the search tree property. Used as a common base class for self-balancing trees.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    protected BinaryTree.Node<E> rotateLeft​(BinaryTree.Node<E> localRoot)
    rotateLeft pre: localRoot is the root of a binary search tree post: localRoot.right is the root of a binary search tree localRoot.right.right is raised one level localRoot.right.left does not change levels localRoot.left is lowered one level the new localRoot is returned.
    protected BinaryTree.Node<E> rotateRight​(BinaryTree.Node<E> root)
    Method to perform a right rotation.

  • Method Details

    • rotateRight

      protected BinaryTree.Node<E> rotateRight​(BinaryTree.Node<E> root)
      Method to perform a right rotation. pre: root is the root of a binary search tree. post: root.right is the root of a binary search tree, root.right.right is raised one level, root.right.left does not change levels, root.left is lowered one level, the new root is returned.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the binary tree to be rotated
      Returns:
      The new root of the rotated tree

    • rotateLeft

      protected BinaryTree.Node<E> rotateLeft​(BinaryTree.Node<E> localRoot)
      rotateLeft pre: localRoot is the root of a binary search tree post: localRoot.right is the root of a binary search tree localRoot.right.right is raised one level localRoot.right.left does not change levels localRoot.left is lowered one level the new localRoot is returned.
      Parameters:
      localRoot - The root of the binary tree to be rotated
      Returns:
      the new root of the rotated tree
